errors.VLD_000: Draft is currently not expecting actions
errors.VLD_001: Acting user is not supposed to act according to preset
errors.VLD_002: Action is unexpected according to preset
errors.VLD_010: Action is not permissible with that option
errors.VLD_900: The server could not process the preset properly
errors.VLD_901: The preset contains an invalid sequence of parallel turns
errors.VLD_902: The preset contains a parallel turn that does not require player interaction
errors.VLD_903: The preset contains a parallel turn which is followed by a turn that does not require player interaction
errors.VLD_904: The last turn of the preset is a parallel turn, which is not possible
errors.VLD_905: The preset contains a parallel turn which is to be executed by the same player as the next turn
errors.VLD_906: The preset contains a hidden ban and a pick without a reveal turn in between
errors.VLD_907: The preset contains a hidden turn that is never revealed
errors.VLD_908: The preset does not contain any turns
errors.VLD_910: Your DraftOptions contain an invalid DraftOption id
errors.VLD_911: Your DraftOptions ids are not unique, probably because two have the same name
errors.VLD_912: Admin turns cannot steal or snipe
errors.VLD_914: Only Admin turns can use the reveal action
errors.VLD_999: Something went very wrong during validation

home.title: What is Captains Mode?
home.1: Captains mode is a turn-based civilisation picker. It can also be used to draft from custom options.
home.2: The tournament Admin creates a <1>Preset</1> which can be used to create <3>Drafts</3>. During a Draft, the two captains pick, ban, steal, or snipe civilisations or options in a predefined order as per the rules in the chosen Preset to determine which civilisations will be available to each captain in a match.
home.3: For each turn captains have <1>30 seconds</1>. In case of a timeout, a random civilisation or option is selected for the captain.

getStarted.title: Get Started
getStarted.1: You can create your own preset or use one of many popular presets <1>here</1>.
getStarted.2: You can spectate currently live and recently created drafts <1>here</1>.
getStarted.3: If you would like to learn more about how to create presets, you can read the instructions <1>here</1>.

reportIssue.title: Found an Issue?
reportIssue.github: Have you found or experienced a problem on this site? Check the <1>list of known issues on GitHub</1>.
reportIssue.discord: If your problem is not listed there, report it on GitHub or describe it to <1>hszemi#2325</1> on Discord. Make sure to include a link to your draft if you have one!

hostAndGuestTurns.title: Host and Guest turns
hostAndGuestTurns.1: Turns have a main action (<1>PICK</1>, <3>BAN</3>, <5>SNIPE</5>) and a few possible modifiers.
hostAndGuestTurns.2: A <1>PICK</1> adds a usable civilisation or option for a player.
hostAndGuestTurns.3: A <1>GLOBAL PICK</1> or <3/> prevents either player from picking the civilisation or option again in a future turn.
hostAndGuestTurns.4: An <1>EXCLUSIVE PICK</1> or <3/> prevents only the picking player from picking the civilisation or option again in a future turn.
hostAndGuestTurns.5: A <1>NONEXCLUSIVE PICK</1> or <3/> does neither of those things, meaning players are still able to pick the civilisation or option again in a future turn.
hostAndGuestTurns.6: A <1>BAN</1> marks the civilisation or option as not available for future turns.
hostAndGuestTurns.7: A <1>GLOBAL BAN</1> or <3/> prevents either player from picking or banning the civilisation or option in a future turn.
hostAndGuestTurns.8: An <1>EXCLUSIVE BAN</1> or <3/> prevents only the opponent from picking the civilisation or option in a future turn and the player who banned the civilisation or option from banning the same civilisation or option again in a future turn.
hostAndGuestTurns.9: A <1>NONEXCLUSIVE BAN</1> or <3/> prevents only the opponent from picking the civilisation or option in a future turn, and the player may ban the the civilisation or option again in a future turn, which makes no sense, so you probably want to use <5>EXCLUSIVE</5> instead anyway.
hostAndGuestTurns.10: A <1/> allows a player to remove a civilisation or option again which the opponent has picked in a previous turn. The <3>GLOBAL</3>, <5>EXCLUSIVE</5> and <7>NONEXCLUSIVE</7> modifiers have no meaning here.
hostAndGuestTurns.11: A <1/> allows a player to remove a civilisation or option which the opponent has picked (or stolen!) in a previous turn, and add it to their own picks. The <3>GLOBAL</3>, <5>EXCLUSIVE</5> and <7>NONEXCLUSIVE</7> modifiers have no meaning here.

adminTurns.title: Admin Turns
adminTurns.1: Admin turns or <1/> reveals the previous set of actions which were hidden.
adminTurns.2: The <1>REVEAL_PICKS</1>, <3>REVEAL_BANS</3> and <5>REVEAL_SNIPES</5> turns reveal the respective hidden actions that were executed before.
adminTurns.3: <0>REVEAL_ALL</0> reveals all hidden actions that were executed before.

presetEditor.title: Preset Editor
presetEditor.1: Presets are made up by individual Turns.
presetEditor.2: Each turn has an acting player: The Host, the Guest, or neither of those (so called "Admin" turns).
presetEditor.3: You can add a Host/Admin/Guest turn by clicking the <1>+ New</1> button below the respective column.
presetEditor.4: You can remove a turn by clicking the <1/> button to the right of the turn.

presetModifiers.title: Modifiers
presetModifiers.1: If you want the players to execute two of their turns in parallel, check the <1>PARALLEL</1> checkbox of the <3>first</3> of those two turns (but do not check it for the second turn).
presetModifiers.2: Check the <1>HIDDEN</1> checkbox to hide the civilisation or option selected during that turn from the opponent and from spectators until it is revealed by an admin turn (see below).
presetModifiers.3: If you check the <1>AS OPPONENT</1> checkbox, the player will execute the turn on behalf of their opponent. This can be used to have players pick civilisations or option that their opponent will then have to use.

draftModifiers.title: Modifiers
draftModifiers.1: A <1>PARALLEL</1> modifier means both the players to execute their turns in parallel.
draftModifiers.2: A <1>HIDDEN</1> modifier hides the civilisation or option selected during that turn from the opponent and from spectators until it is revealed by an admin turn (see below).
draftModifiers.3: An <1>AS OPPONENT</1> modifier means that the turn is executed by the player on behalf of their opponent. This is mainly useful to have a player pick civilisations or option for their opponent to use.

presetEditor.warning: <0>Attention!</0><1/>This is advanced stuff, and you probably do not need it if you just want to create a regular old civilisation draft.<3/><4>Please use image urls which you expect to still be working in about ten years or more!</4>

codeInstructionsAfter: Use this code to spectate this draft again later:
